title: Scottish Economics and Social Science Knowledge Exchange Network
abstractText:
The Governments in Scotland and UK are committed to a knowledge economy where the universities are an important mechanism for generating and preserving, disseminating and transforming knowledge into wider social and economic benefits from improved healthcare to informed policy-making on crime.

The Scottish Economics and Social Science Knowledge Exchange Network has been established to support knowledge exchange practitioners from across Scottish Higher Education Institutions.

The range of subjects that the members cover from law to social sciences from business management to archaeology, the number of scientists they support and the research that they produce mean that these practitioners engage with a wide range of external audiences from Government, business and the non-profit sector.

The members of the network support the scientists undertaking knowledge exchange in economics and social sciences departments. As these members work in individual Universities or departments without the events and activities proposed under this grant they have no opportunities to meet and share common issues and best practice. The activities proposed include regular updates via an e-bulletin, three annual events where the group can meet and one event where the end users of the research - businesses and third sector organisations - so that new partnerships can be established.
